1.title: Live by the Code
1.plot: A concerned mother has great difficulty getting her child's school to believe that bullying could possibly be going on there. After all, they have a code.

2.title: Enviromental
2.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "Are you concerned with humanity's overuse of plastic?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked.

3.title: The Montage Entourage
3.plot: Jim is training for the big 20k race, but it is not going very well. Can the Underdog overcome the odds with the help of his friend's unusual training methods?

4.title: The Communication Situation
4.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "Are you concerned about Facebook selling off user's personal data?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked.

5.title: Clocks Away
5.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "If you could go anywhere in History when would it be?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked.

6.title: Testing Times
6.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "What are your views on Animal Testing?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked.

7.title: Is it Vegan?
7.plot: A picky customer runs a waiter ragged over ensuring absolutely everything about her eating experience has in no way been derived from animals.

8.title: Meanwhile, in Hollywood VII: The Farce Awakens
8.plot: A script writer tries to pitch a TV show without having a single word or idea planned going into the meeting.

9.title: The Smell of Money
9.plot: An R+D assistant proposes a radical new idea to his bosses at Smelly Pits deodorants. It would be fair to say that they think it stinks.

10.title: Bank on it
10.plot: When Johnny gets given ten pounds by his Grandma, an astute banker tries to persuade him how best to invest it.

11.title: The Greatest Show on Earth
11.plot: A ringmaster tries to persuade a potential customer to come see his show of wonderment.

12.title: How to Talk to Girls
12.plot: Are you single and ready to mingle? Want to find the Juliet to your Romeo? Well, you better listen to Flynn's 4-step easy to follow guide on "How to Talk to Girls."

13.title: The IRL Store
13.plot: Internet gone down? How ever will you do your shopping now? Well, fear not. Just come on down to the In Real Life store for the full reality based shopping experience.

14.title: Imagine That
14.plot: Two friends. One real and one imaginary, but which one is which?

15.title: Meanwhile, in 1852
15.plot: 2 Lovers. One a hopeless romantic, the other a pragmatic shrew. Will it last?

16.title: Meanwhile, in 1912
16.plot: Is honesty really the virtue we make it out to be? History proves this is not always the case when young Spencer Cothropen goes for a job interview.

17.title: Take a Chance on me
17.plot: Gambling is wrong. Dead wrong. This public health infomercial explains why.

18.title: A Spoonful of Surgery
18.plot: In the wake of combating childhood obesity, is there really any room for Mary's archaic approach to getting children to take medicine?

19.title: An American Porch Story
19.plot: A father tries to inspires his son by regaling a tale of his past days of sporting glory.

20.title: Meanwhile, in Hollywood 8
20.plot: A Hollywood studio owner is presented with a chance to change the film making landscape as we know it.

1.title: Meanwhile in Hollywood
1.plot: A Hollywood studio owner gets thinking about his next movie, never mind the idea was already done 30 years ago, reboots are surely what everybody wants?

2.title: Worth the Weight
2.plot: A couple visit a bizarre restaurant that serves no food whatsoever. Things get weird...fast.

3.title: Nothing to Say
3.plot: Two old friends meet up for the first time in 5 years, but with the rise of Social Media, what don't they already know about each other?

4.title: Spies Not Like Us
4.plot: An overzealous special agent gets set up by his boss to do his household chores, but things don't go according to plan.

5.title: A Little Chat
5.plot: Two men have an awkward conversation in a shopping store while waiting for their partners.

6.title: Meanwhile, Back in Hollywood
6.plot: An actor attends his agent's office to try and discover why he has not had any work in three years. Things quickly become farcical.

7.title: Therapy Is Super
7.plot: The heroes of Marvel and DC heroes attend a therapy group session in order to "stop being so addicted to superpowers" and try to return to living a normal life.

8.title: Meanwhile, in Book Club
8.plot: Tarquin, Mindy, and Hubert are the keen intellectual thinkers of their local book club. So when newcomer, Harry, dares to suggest their reading material isn't actually all that high-brow, things quickly become farcical.

1.title: Meanwhile, in the 1950's
1.plot: The Jones family acquire a new fangled telephone - the first on their street! But if nobody else actually has one yet, whatever are they going to do with it?

2.title: Meanwhile, in the NHS
2.plot: Dr. Miles Brownrigg is a successful brain surgeon at an NHS Hospital. That is, until the Hospital Director sends him packing to a local GP Surgery due to budget cuts. It doesn't go well.

3.title: The Milky Way
3.plot: Curtis and Jake are two roommates that just about tolerate each other's existence. That is until one day Jake discovers something very disturbing about Curtis's drinking habits.

4.title: Soul Survivor
4.plot: A Religious Recruiter stops a passer by to try and tell them about his religion. But much to their surprise, they actually do stop and want to listen, leaving the Advocate in the very awkward position of actually having to talk about it - something he has no actual prior experience in doing.

5.title: Fire Therapy
5.plot: An arsonist is ordered by police to attend rehabilitation therapy. It doesn't go well.

6.title: Meanwhile, in Shoreditch
6.plot: A man visits a funky new cereal cafe in Shoreditch. They guarantee to take you right back to your childhood...even to the rubbish bits.

7.title: Meanwhile, in IT Support
7.plot: A caller rings an IT Support Desk after his Internet connection goes down. He soon wishes he hadn't bothered....

8.title: Meanwhile, in the Adoption Agency
8.plot: A couple attend the final stages of the adoption process after three years of rigorous tests and training. But only now do they start to wonder whether they actually want children........

9.title: Meanwhile, Returning to Hollywood
9.plot: It's time for the Oscars again! And with it comes the inevitable gushing speeches, but what if one actress were to actually say exactly what was on her mind...

10.title: Meanwhile, in the Christmas Cracker Factory
10.plot: Things quickly turn less than humorous when a young newbie at the Christmas Cracker factory mistakenly writes a joke that is remotely funny....

11.title: Meanwhile, Back in the NHS
11.plot: A man attends his local G.P hoping to find some answers to his low mood, only to find his appointment turn more depressing than his actual ailments.

12.title: Meanwhile, in the 1990's
12.plot: 1996 clashes with 2016 when 90's bully Brad Johnson is forced to battle his 2016 counterpart after causing a riff in the time space continuum.

13.title: Spiritual Therapy
13.plot: A man visits a medium. To say her skills were poor would be generous....

14.title: Face the Music
14.plot: Chat show host Cara McQueen welcomes Uber Pop Starlet Jillian Jane onto her daytime chat show. It doesn't go very well....

15.title: What's the Score?
15.plot: Over at Channel CLIVE, Useless Sport anchor, Football Clive, gives the latest on the football. If only he had an interest or an idea about the game...

16.title: I Ain't Afraid of No Therapy
16.plot: After being replaced by an all female team, the original Ghostbusters are sent to therapy to try and come to terms with their situation.

17.title: Done Deal
17.plot: A girl tries a new approach to having a successful yard sale.

18.title: Dial a for Annoying
18.plot: Everything is going great in Andrew, Alice, and Angelica's lives, until they get THAT phone call..

19.title: A Guide to Etiquette and How Not to Do It
19.plot: A party guest commits a terrible social faux pas when she misunderstands the basic etiquette law of "You shouldn't have."

20.title: Meanwhile, in Hollywood IV: No Hope
20.plot: A young actress attends an audition for a big exciting Independent Movie. But does it all sound too good to be true?

21.title: Nightmares and Underwears
21.plot: Freddy is forced to face up to his childhood nightmares, but can they still scare him in adulthood?

22.title: Out of Five, Clive?
22.plot: Over at the inept news station Channel CLIVE, Movie Clive prepares to deliver his latest vague review on some sort of film he has seen. Or something.

23.title: Taken for Granted
23.plot: Two research scientists make the fatal mistake of actually finishing a project before time and under budget....

24.title: When Zodiacs Attack
24.plot: Derek is a Horoscope writer with a difference., No matter what he writes, literally the exact opposite tends to happen...

25.title: Meanwhile, in Hollywood V: The Ego Strikes Back
25.plot: A director trying to make a commercial about Baked Beans. It is a fairly simple shoot, until his 2 actors insist they know how to make it to better....but do they?

26.title: Shop Till You Drop
26.plot: A man goes shopping in Carrot Land. There isn't much produce to choose from, but that is normally the least of the customers worries...

27.title: A Guide to Etiquette and How Not to Do It 2
27.plot: The Faction of Farce presents another handy guide on how to not act in public in decent British society.

28.title: Meanwhile, in Geneva
28.plot: Victor Frankenstein prepares to show off his latest creation...the greatest monster in the entire land!

29.title: Super Fun Park Rangers
29.plot: Concerned with excessive mobile phone use, the government create a public info film to educate children on the super fun benefits of the park.

30.title: Generation Snowflake
30.plot: A student takes being offended on behalf of another a little too far.

31.title: Aliens Anonymous
31.plot: A UFO spotters club meets up to swap their latest tales of peril and probes...

32.title: Reaching for the Past
32.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "What T.V show would you bring back if you could?." But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked....

33.title: Plastic Fantastic
33.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "Would You Ever Have Plastic Surgery?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked...

34.title: The Maternal Truth
34.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks mothers the question"Do You Have a Favourite Child?." But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked..

35.title: Jekyll and Rye
35.plot: A man with a very split personality visits a Sandwich Shop. It doesn't go very well....

36.title: The Increasingly Depressing Tale of John Postlewaite
36.plot: The Increasingly Depressing Tale of John Postlewaite is the sorry story of a man whose life starts out great, but only ever gets increasingly worse from there.

37.title: All Going According to Plan
37.plot: Karen employs a wedding planner to assist her in the preparation for the big day. However, what she does not plan on is just how crazy her assistant is going to be...

38.title: Dungeons and Decisions
38.plot: The hero of Engha sets out to recover the ring of truth, but no matter how brave he maybe or what weapons he may wield, the outcome of his mission rests in the choices of another.

39.title: Man vs. Dog
39.plot: Brian, Stephanie, and William Hart are a family just like any other, but with the strange exception of William being older than both his parents.

40.title: Meanwhile, in the Registrar's Office
40.plot: A couple attends a registrar's office to register the name of their new daughter. It doesn't go very well....

41.title: Going Up
41.plot: A girl tries to get to the 22nd floor, but unfortunately for her, she presses all the wrong buttons of one particularly pedantic lift traveler...

42.title: A Political Storm
42.plot: Another thrilling edition of Clive TV. On this episode we have an interview with the leader of "The I Can't Be Bothered To Vote" Party. Plus, more useless weather warnings from Weather Clive.

43.title: It's a Conspiracy!
43.plot: Expert Conspiracy Theorist, Nick Biscuit, brings damning proof of a cover up by the BBC 18 years ago.

44.title: Ghost of a Chance
44.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "Have You Ever Seen a Ghost?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked...

45.title: Caffeine Fiend
45.plot: Welcome to Coffee Land. They serve everything and everything you could ever want in terms of flavour, ingredients, and silly long Americanised names. But what should happen if someone were to go in for just, you know, a coffee........

46.title: Plane Stupid
46.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "Should there be a third runway at Heathrow Airport?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked...

47.title: Corporation Duplication
47.plot: The CEO of Corporation Corp is on the hunt for a new Office Manager. Does Miss Earl have what it takes? Or is she just another ten-a-penny carbon copy employee?

48.title: The Perils of Publishing
48.plot: When a failing publishing firm hits the rocks, who can be trusted to bring it back to relevancy? Enter hammy author Booster Crispin with his epic one sentence novel...

49.title: Beauty Is in the Eye of the Shopholder
49.plot: A man goes shopping in Face Cream Land. There isn't much produce to choose from, but that is normally the least of the customers worries...

50.title: The F-Factor
50.plot: It's time for another thrilling audition round of The F-Factor. The reality TV show where true talent is all but an optional requirement...

51.title: A Farcical Christmas
51.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "What are you most looking forward to about Christmas?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked...

52.title: The Importance of God Grades
52.plot: A couple try and get their child baptized so that he may be able to go to a decent Church school, but their lack of knowledge on all things biblical may just makes things a little bit tricky.

1.title: Happy Go Larry
1.plot: A mockumentary on the origins of the phrase "Happy as Larry" following a day in the life of THE original Larry that the phrase was coined from.

2.title: An Australian Oddessy
2.plot: An Australian couple's idyllic life is interrupted by the arrival of a mysterious letter.

3.title: A Lesson in Lunacy
3.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "What do you think of the current state of British Education?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked.

4.title: Drew Brady and His Amazing Socks
4.plot: Have you ever bought a pair of socks? Well, you have been doing it all wrong for years. Drew Brady explains why.

5.title: The Enigma of the Empire
5.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "What does Brexit mean to you?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked.

6.title: Tattooine
6.plot: Dog owns a Tattoo shop. He loves his job, but not always his clients..

7.title: Swood Life
7.plot: An Advertising agency has made an advert in the 1990's and is still trying to peddle it to anybody who uses their service, regardless of what the product is, or how relevant it would be.

8.title: The Unfinished Scriptathy
8.plot: The Faction of Farce assemble to go over the latest script. Slight teething problem is that Ross has not finished writing it yet..

9.title: Heists and Hedgefunds
9.plot: Mr. Beano becomes the newest employee of Corporation Corp and joins their pension plan. It turns out to be the last thing that he ever does.

10.title: Terrornology
10.plot: A mini mockumentary about the unexplored problems that modern day technology presents for our monsters, mythical beings, and folk legends.

11.title: Scared Stupid
11.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "Do you have any phobias?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked.

12.title: The Reborn Supremacy
12.plot: Kathy believes that she has achieved her most perfect final form of reincarnation, and now knows everything there is to know. Suffice to say, she is quite annoying about it..

13.title: Meanwhile, in Hollywood VI
13.plot: A script writer manages to impresses Studio Bosses with her film script. Problem is, they do want some changes. But it can't be anything too major, right?

14.title: Do or Diet
14.plot: A Faction of Farce Vox Pop Special which asks the question "What is the best diet to follow?" But, of course, only the weirdest of people seem to get asked.

15.title: Meanwhile, in the 1940's
15.plot: A world war 2 private stumbles across a very dangerous concept in social engineering. Is an outbreak of moral imminent? Not if the secret service have anything to say on the matter.

16.title: Day of the Downward Dog
16.plot: An outdoor yoga class receives a surprise license check from the Council. Things start to get stressful..

17.title: Meanwhile, Returning to the Registrar's Office
17.plot: A couple attend the registrar's office to register the name of their child. Sadly, they are met with a somewhat jobsworth of a registrar who seeks to make everything as awkward and difficult as possible.

18.title: Taken for Granted 2
18.plot: A team of scientists present their findings to a grant panel on how humans might be trained to resist all forms of pain. It doesn't go very well.

19.title: Meanwhile, Returning to the NHS
19.plot: A hypochondriac google's his own illness and is convinced that his doctor has incorrectly diagnosed him as dead. Can he persuade him otherwise? Or will the over zealous Doctor's hatred of Dr. Google blind his opinion?

20.title: Whoops! Where's My Trousers?
20.plot: Welcome to WHOOPS. WHERE'S MY TROUSERS. The only Game Show where you must remain fully dressed at all times to win.

imdb.title: The Faction of Farce
plot: _The Faction of Farce_ (qv) is a web comedy sketch show with sketches of a random, obscure, and bizarre nature.::Ross K Foad
